snippet: The 2013 sinking of a flimsy boat carrying more than 500 people off the Italian island of Lampedusa was a signature moment in Europe’s migration crisis. Survivors share their stories.
abstract: Migrants who have successfully reached European countries like Sweden express both their gratitude and disillusion in their attempts to live better, more secure lives; thousands of immigrants persist in running gauntlet of dangers to reach Europe, as leaders there promise to do more to aid them.

byline.contributor: Henrik Pryser Libell contributed reporting from Oslo.

lead_paragraph: The 2013 sinking of a flimsy boat carrying more than 500 people off the Italian island of Lampedusa was a signature moment in Europe’s migration crisis. Survivors share their stories.

headline.main: Migrants Who Survived Shipwreck Are Grateful, but Disillusioned
headline.print_headline: For Migrants, Both Gratitude and Disillusion

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
